text.0: een to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of cow is given.
text.1: the one hath swelled among mankind for milking pṛśni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.
text.2: they who like kindled flames of fire are glowing the maruts twice and thrice have waxen mighty.
text.3: golden and dustless were their cars invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.
text.4: they who are sons of the rainpouring rudra whom the longlasting one had power to foster.
text.5: the mighty ones whose germ great mother pṛśni is known to have received for mans advantage.
text.6: they shrink not from the birth in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches.
text.7: when they have streamed forth brilliant at their pleasure with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.
text.8: even those who bear the brave bold name of maruts whom not the active quickly wins for milking.
text.9: even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones those who are light and agile in their greatness.
text.10: when strong in strength and armed with potent weapons they had united wellformed earth and heaven.
text.11: rodasl stood among these furious heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.
text.12: no team of goats shall draw your car o maruts no horse no charioteer be he who drives it.
text.13: halting not reinless through the air it travels speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.
text.14: none may obstruct none overtake o maruts him whom ye succour in the strife of battle.
text.15: for sons and progeny for kine and waters he bursts the cowstall on the day of trial.
text.16: bring a bright hymn to praise the band of maruts the singers rapid strong in native vigour.
text.17: who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty earth shakes in terror at their wars o agni.
text.18: bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset.
text.19: chanting their psalm singing aloud like heroes splendid from birth invincible the maruts.
text.20: that swelling band i call with invocation the brood of rudra armed with glittering lances.
text.21: pure hymns are meet for that celestial army like floods and mountains have the strong ones battled.
